Cyril. I like that. I can see it. Is that the end?

Vivian. No. There is one more passage,
but it is purely practical. It simply suggests
some methods by which we could
revive this lost art of Lying.

Cyril. Well, before you read it to me, I
should like to ask you a question.
What do you mean by saying that
life, "poor, probable, uninteresting human life," will try to reproduce the
marvels of art? I can quite
understand your objection to Aart
being treated as a mirror. You
think it would reduce genius to
the position of a crackedlooking-glass.
But you don't mean to say that
you seriously believe that Life imitates
Art, that Life in fact is the
mirror, and Art the reality?
